comment.author: 23212874@N00
comment._content: Presumably Wilbur R Kimball who made some fantastic looking machines: www.earlyaviators.com/ekimball.htm

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Wilbur R. Kimball, pilot, inventor, airplane builder, aviation pioneer, was Secretary of the Aeronautic Society of New York.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo gives us a closeup glimpse of Wilur R. Kimball:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163498802/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
Kimball was one of the first to rent a hangar at Belmont Park (New York) racetrack in 1911. Kimball tested this aircraft at Belmont Park during June and July 1911.  This photo was taken at Belmont Park. The names of the aviator's from the October 1910 International Airmeet are still visible on the hangars.
Kimball never received a pilot's license from the Aero Club of America.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks Early Aviation for the information about the site of this photograph. We'll add this information to the record the next time we update.
